intro: Drypetes palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan drypetes, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in lowland to hill forest environments and is often found in secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
